labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.3.9-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/80118
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** n/a
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution
**Device used:** Mac 15.4.1 Safari, iPhone 13 iOS 26.2
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com
2.Create a group chat with two other existing accounts, send a message in the chat
3.Split a scan expense in the group chat, uploading an image so the scan fails

## Expected Result:
The "Review required" violation is displayed on the failed scan split preview.
Missing amount and merchant fields should have a error indicating crucial information is missing

## Actual Result:
The "Review required" violation is missing on the failed scan split preview, and there are no errors in the split details page

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d792186-6d9f-4cc7-9696-2ca855a1cc01

[View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Split - Split Dates range shifts one day earlier from start date

labels.name: External

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.8-3 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-3390/folder/13176791/71461417/1146028714?sort=%2Bidentifier **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Windows 10 **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: 1. Go to a workspace 2. Create an expense for $200 as a submitter 3. Click on "More" and select "Split" 4. Click on the "Date" pill 5. Click on the "Split dates" 6. Set the start date as the 16th 7. Set the end date as the 18th and tap Save 8. Verify that three splits are created with equal amounts adding up to the original transaction amount Result: The split dates are created for 15, 16, and 17 instead of 16, 17, and 18. 9. Try with another day ranges Result: Split dates range shifts one day earlier from start date ## Expected Result: Three splits are created from start day to end day (16, 17, and 18), with equal amounts adding up to the original transaction amount. ## Actual Result: Split dates range shifts one day earlier from start date (15,16,17) ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f6b0b8d8-82f3-4af3-a3fb-902c3a0028fd [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.8-2 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176933/test-cases/41237708 https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176944/test-cases/41237731 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** MacBook Air 15.7.3 Chrome, iPhone 15 iOS 26.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in to ND 2. Create a workspace 3. Create a scan expense with a valid receipt in the workspace chat 4. Create another scan expense in the workspace chat, uploading an image, that will fail the scan 5. When the scan is completed, open the expense details 6. Start a group chat, create a split - scan - upload an image, that will fail the scan 7. When scan is failed, open the details ## Expected Result: Step 5 - The amount field is empty and have the error state displayed Step 7 - The amount field is empty, shows an error, has a right caret and editable. The Split button is presented ## Actual Result: Step 5 - The amount field is filled with $0.00 and does not show an error. When clicking on the field, the amount input is empty. Step 7 - For failed scan split in group the amount field is filled with $0.00, the field is not editable. User is not able to edit the split ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a0cafbb3-8893-4ba8-b19d-b09d0bd97329 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

labels.name: External

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.8-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13177075/test-cases/41237824 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Windows 11, Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Set the test account as follows: - Account > Preferences > Payment currency > USD - Account > Wallet > Enable Wallet (select US bank account, and add a Wallet) 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com. 2. Sign in with the user who has a Wallet added. 3. Open a chat with a user that does not have an account yet. 4. Click on + within the chat > Pay {Username} > select an amount, then click Next. 5. Click Pay > Pay with Wallet. 6. Open the expense report. 7. In the chat, click X next to the error message: “Unexpected error. Please try again later.” (displayed below the “Paid with Wallet” comment). ## Expected Result: After dismissing an error when attempting to Pay with Wallet, the expense report should disappear (same behaviour as when dismissing the error with 'X' below the receipt) ## Actual Result: After dismissing an error when attempting to Pay with Wallet, the expense report enters an endless loading state. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a8a622f4-9e40-46e7-80fe-2ef489270d7b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Expense-No options in tax code page and It's not here page after clicking Keep this one

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.8-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/447179
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Windows 11 Pro
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
Workspace A has tax rates, categories, and tags enabled.
Workspace B does not have the taxes, categories, and tags features enabled.

1.	Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2.	Open the chat for Workspace A.
3.	Submit an expense in Workspace A with a tax rate, category, and tag (use the same amount and merchant).
4.	Submit another expense in Workspace A with all fields left empty (defaults).
5.	Open the chat for Workspace B.
6.	Submit an expense in Workspace B with the same amount and merchant as the previous entries.
7.	Open the transaction thread for the expense submitted in Workspace B.
8.	Click "Review Duplicates."
9.	Choose "Keep this one" for the first transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped since Workspace B does not have these features enabled.
10.	Return to the initial duplicate review step (where you select the transaction to keep).
11.	Choose "Keep this one" for the second transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
12.	Repeat steps 9 and 10 for the third transaction, ensuring the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped since it belongs to Workspace A.
13.	Return to the chat for Workspace A and open any transaction thread for an expense submitted there.
14.	Click "Review Duplicates."
15.	Choose "Keep this one" for the first transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
16.	Return to the initial duplicate review step.
17.	Choose "Keep this one" for the second transaction and verify that the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped since Workspace A has these features enabled.
18.	Return to the initial duplicate review step again.
19.	Choose "Keep this one" for the third transaction and confirm that the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped, as this transaction belongs to Workspace B, which does not have these features enabled.

## Expected Result:
In steps 11 and 12, for the second and third transactions, the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
In steps 15 and 17, for the first and second transactions, the tax, tag, and category review step is not skipped, as Workspace A has these features enabled.
In step 19, for the third transaction, the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped, and the user navigates to the confirm page.

## Actual Result:
In step 11, for the second transaction, the tax, tag, and category review step is skipped. After clicking on the back arrow, the tax code page is displayed without options.
In step 12, for the third transaction, the category review step is skipped. The tax code page is displayed without options.
In steps 15 and 17, for the first and second transactions, the tax code page is displayed without options.
In step 19, for the third transaction, the "It's not here" page is displayed.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [ ] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

## Screenshots/Videos

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d946ce3b-ce84-47e5-872c-1f7680e2f93f

**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/281858
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution 
**Device used:** Windows Windows 11 Pro
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1. Go to Settings -> Profile -> Contact methods
2. Click on "New contact method" button
3. Add email/phone with leading and trailing spaces e.g “ test@test.com ”
4. Tap Add button

## Expected Result:
The contact method gets added and the leading/trailing spaces does not show while display email/phone number.

## Actual Result:
A new contacts method is not added and the app doesn't navigate to the contact methods page if the contact method has trailing spaces.

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Device used:** macOS Sequoia 15.4.1 
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website.
2. Open any workspace chat.
3. Create a manual expense.
4. Open the expense report and tap on the header.
5. Tap on "Share" and copy the expense´s link.
6. Return to conversation, long tap on expense preview and delete it.
7. Navigate to a different chat.
8. Paste and send the deleted expense link.
9. Tap on the link.

## Expected Result:
The user should be redirected to an error page.

## Actual Result:
Share code link doesn't work after deleting an expense

## Workaround:
Unknown
